context: I was really excited about the Jimmy Buffett concert. My friend Jeff was going to come to pick me up at six in the evening. But I was feeling sleepy and took a little nap at about four o'clock. When I finally woke up it was nearly eight o'clock at night!
choices: When I finally woke up it was nearly eight o'clock at night!

context: I was walking to my house after riding the school bus. When I arrived at the front, I tried to open the door. The door was locked. When I tried to look for my keys, I couldn't find it anywhere.
choices: When I tried to look for my keys, I couldn't find it anywhere.

context: My roommate made fish for dinner last night. Unfortunately, the fish was very bad. Even still, I ate it because he had worked so hard. When I was done, he told me he hated how the meal turned out.
choices: When I was done, he told me he hated how the meal turned out.

context: Greg was a messy person. And he ate every meal at his computer desk. One day, he spilled soda all over his keyboard. When it was his birthday, a friend bought him a new keyboard.
choices: When it was his birthday, a friend bought him a new keyboard.

context: On the fourth of July, the bank held an ice cream party. A mom took her toddler to it. They stood in line. When it was their turn, they got a balloon and some ice cream.
choices: When it was their turn, they got a balloon and some ice cream.

context: Nancy just came home from work. She grabbed her phone after it vibrated. She received a message from her boyfriend, who asked her to break-up. When she called him, he didn't pick up his phone.
choices: When she called him, he didn't pick up his phone.

context: Liz was watching her four and six-year-old nieces. She put them in her room to take a nap. They were very quiet so she thought they were asleep. When she checked on them an hour later they were not asleep.
choices: When she checked on them an hour later they were not asleep.

context: Mary's family was getting together for a holiday dinner at the club. Everyone was going to be there except for Mary's Grandfather. Mary was sad that the whole family would not be together. When she got to the club, she was surprised to see her grandfather!
choices: When she got to the club, she was surprised to see her grandfather!

context: Nancy was trying to print out her class assignment. The printer caught an error and froze. It took several minutes to reboot. When she received the papers, they were empty.
choices: When she received the papers, they were empty.

context: Amy wanted to make waffles for breakfast. She whipped up some batter quickly. She poured the batter into the maker. When she was eating them there were lumps of the dry batter.
choices: When she was eating them there were lumps of the dry batter.

context: Sarah was very hungry. She went to the kitchen to eat, but only had bread. She made some toast, with butter and jam. When she was walking to the table, she dropped the toast.
choices: When she was walking to the table, she dropped the toast.

context: Mary went to the market on Sunday for fruit. She bought bananas but couldn't find any peaches. She decided that she would wait on the peaches until next time. When she went again there were still no peaches.
choices: When she went again there were still no peaches.

context: Mark's parents had an announcement. They were going to have a baby. Mark was mad and went to his room. When the baby cam, Mark went up to him.
choices: When the baby cam, Mark went up to him.

context: Kathie does not like babies. One day, she became pregnant. She was concerned she might not like her baby. When the baby was born, she fell in love with the baby.
choices: When the baby was born, she fell in love with the baby.

context: On the fourth of July, Lilly baked a lemon blueberry cake. She brought it to her boyfriend's house and they had a barbeque. After dinner, they drove into the city to watch fireworks. When the show was over, they got donuts from a food truck.
choices: When the show was over, they got donuts from a food truck.

context: The Brown family was going to the Grand Canyon. They all piled in the car and began their drive from Iowa. There were many stops along the way and the trip was long. When they arrived at the Canyon the kids hopped out of the car.
choices: When they arrived at the Canyon the kids hopped out of the car.

context: Maggie has a dog. She takes her dog for walks. They go to the park and play. When they come home Maggie feeds her dog.
choices: When they come home Maggie feeds her dog.

context: Katie decided it would be fun to dye some Easter eggs. She got her siblings together and they started dying a dozen. The chose all different colors. When they were done they looked beautiful.
choices: When they were done they looked beautiful.

context: When I turned eighteen, I registered to vote. I was so excited to participate in the democratic process. I did research on each and every candidate. When voting day came, I went to the polling station.
choices: When voting day came, I went to the polling station.

context: One Christmas, I received a shiny and expensive-looking briefcase. The next day, I filled my new case and gathered my things. I set the briefcase on the roof temporarily while I loaded the car. While I was driving, people were beeping at me.
choices: While I was driving, people were beeping at me.

context: Ethan was moving into an apartment downtown. He really didn't consider the changes he'd make going from a house. So it really hit hard when he set up his drum set. Within ten minutes he had five noise complaints.
choices: Within ten minutes he had five noise complaints.

context: Nicole wanted to be an Aunt more than anything. The trouble was that she didn't have any siblings. Today Nicole got a note from her cousin, Xiao. Xiao and her husband were expecting a baby boy.
choices: Xiao and her husband were expecting a baby boy.

context: Steve was feeling upset so he went to the grocery store. He bought sugar, eggs, and flour. He came home and preheated the oven to three-hundred and fifty degrees. When the time came, he put the baking sheet in.
choices: When the time came, he put the baking sheet in.

context: It was time for Manjul to live in a new place. She needed somewhere to be easily walkable to her office in the city square. She also did not have much money to invest in fixing somewhere up. Manjul also wanted somewhere that was cozy.
choices: Manjul also wanted somewhere that was cozy.

context: Hilda was known to be a pretty girl. People said her eyes looked like a clear sky. She wanted to put on a dress and nail polish before going outside. She went to her mom's nail polish kit to pick one out.
choices: She went to her mom's nail polish kit to pick one out.

context: We learned that Mars would be visible the following morning. I set an alarm for the early morning. I got a telescope ready and a flashlight. In the morning, I bundled up and rushed outside.
choices: In the morning, I bundled up and rushed outside.

context: Keith was taking a long road trip to the Grand Canyon. He was behind schedule so he did not want to stop. Since he was feeling tired, Keith drank a lot of coffee and water. He started to feel uncomfortable because of it but refused to stop.
choices: He started to feel uncomfortable because of it but refused to stop.
